column4: When added to SMC, CBT and GET had greater success in reducing fatigue and improving physical function than did APT or SMC alone.
column5: CBT and GET can safely be added to SMC to moderately improve outcomes for chronic fatigue syndrome.
column6: Two effective treatments benefit up to 60 per cent of patients with Chronic Fatigue Syndrome or Myalgic Encephalomyelitis.
column7: Up to 60 per cent of patients improved if therapists encouraged them gradually to do more.
column11: Patients with ME, also known as chronic fatigue sundrome, who are encouraged to “test their limits” mentally and physically do better than those whose therapies help them to adapt to the condition.
column37: Up to 60 per cent of patients improved if therapists encouraged them gradually to do more.
